title: Lizzo sued by dancers over fat shaming (yes, Lizzo), making them eat bananas out of strippers' vaginas
description:
The odds of a story about Lizzo fat-shaming people NOT being the most shocking part of it are as high as her cholesterol. Yet this one includes strippers, bananas, and eating bananas that came out of strippers. You can guess from where.

Lizzo believes in body positivity for me and not for thee, according to a new lawsuit filed by three former dancers. They also allege sexual harassment and a hostile work environment.

The fat-shaming came in the form of a "concern" that the dance wasn't committed anymore. Turns out the word "lazy" is a dog whistle.

According to the lawsuit: “In professional dance, a dancer’s weight gain is often seen as that dancer getting lazy or worse off as a performer. Lizzo’s and Ms. Scott’s questions about Ms. Davis’s commitment to the tour were thinly veiled concerns about Ms. Davis’s weight gain, which Lizzo had previously called attention to after noticing it at the South by Southwest music festival."

For reference, this is Lizzo:

Then there is the degeneracy. The lawsuit highlights a trip to Amsterdam where “… things quickly got out of hand. Lizzo began inviting cast members to take turns touching the nude performers, catching dildos launched from the performers’ vaginas, and eating bananas protruding from the performers’ vaginas.”

More like "this one time at band camp...." Amirite?

What is most humorous about this lawsuit is that exactly two months ago, the plus-sized diva threatened to quit the music business if people didn't stop fat shaming her. Fans and trolls aren't allowed to call her lazy or worse off as a performer. Only she can do that!

Lizzo didn't respond to anyone who asked for comment. The fat-shaming thing is fun because... I mean, look at her. But I can see how that would be hard to prove in court. The banana out of the vagina thing has at a club with eyewitnesses. Whether any of them were too high to remember anything is what discovery is for.

title: Bless his heart: Matthew McConaughey thinks he invented changing the term 'gun control' to something else
description:
Matthew McConaughey is a prime example that while it's fun to have the occasional a-lister who occasionally says things we agree with, we need to slow our roll before declaring them the new voice of conservatism. McConaughey seems like a decent dude. But when it comes to gun rights, he's both wrong and easily confused.

McConaughey was a guest on ABC News’ “This Week” to discuss the "Green Lights Grant Initiative" he started to help schools get grants to increase safety and security. It's in response to the tragic Uvalde killings where children were slaughtered in school because authorities wouldn't use their guns to take down the killer for over an hour. They even stopped someone who wanted to use his gun the save the day.

The actor points to the "Bipartisan Safer Communities Act" which was supposed to provide funds for schools to increase security and mental health services. Twelve schools applied. ZERO has been approved for funding from the government. McConaughey saying "what the f*ck" is why he was invited on the show. But of course, talk turned to gun control.

Stop me if you've heard this one before:

"I changed the word from ‘control’ to ‘responsibility.' Control sounds like a mandate and nobody wants a mandate. No one wants to be controlled. But responsibility is still something that we can all go, yeah, ‘I’ll take responsibility’, and a lot of the far-right or the Republicans, they almost feel like responsibility is a value that they have ownership of and it’s a sense of almost pride and honor to be responsible."

M'kay. Two things. One, I don't know who these far-right or Republicans that McCounghey thinks he's responsibility-splain too. If there is one thing most of us have managed to stay unified in our defense of the Second Amendment.

Two, does my dude really think he invented calling something by a different name to hide the Left's true agenda? That's ALL they do. They don't keep it a secret. Not unlike his "genital mutilation" is now "gender-affirming care."

McConaughey didn't even invent doing it for gun control. Leftists have been attempting to make "common sense gun reform" a thing for years. I know it's gun control. You know it's gun control. They think they're fooling someone.

The saddest thing is this isn't the dumbest gun-related thing McConaughey has said. In 2018 while speaking at a March for Our Lives rally, he claimed it wasn't about taking people's guns away. A month later he realized that the movement WAS about taking guns away. But instead of admitting he should have done more research, claimed the movement was being "hijacked."

title: Ron DeSantis makes an offer that if Kamala Harris wants to lie about Florida's school curriculum, come lie to his face
description:
Anyone remember when Claire Huxtable was invited to join a "The McLaughlin Group" style show, but the old men only wanted her to speak if it was about black or woman things? The White House has that same energy with Kamala Harris. They send her to pro-abortion roundtables, and to Florida where she can lie about what Ron DeSantis thinks of slavery. So the governor is inviting her to lie to his face. Or, to be more precise in my language, "set the record straight."

Florida released their educational standards for Florida schools. They talk about the horrors of slavery. And how terrible slavery was. And what a stain slavery was on American history. Swipe left. 0/10 stars. Would not recommend.

One sentence said, “Instruction includes how slaves developed skills which, in some instances, could be applied for their personal benefit." Harris rushed to Jacksonville to lie and say that sentence said "Middle school students will be taught that enslaved people benefited from slavery."

Much like with "Don't Say Gay," the left knows if they lie they can count on the media to swear by it. This time they had the added benefit of knowing the White House lies would be amplified by DeSantis's chief rival in the presidential race.

DeSantis invited Kamala to have a little chat. “We will be happy to host you here in Tallahassee. I will ask Dr. William Allen–instrumental in the development of our impressive new standards–to join. We welcome you of course, to bring Randi Weingarten or someone else who shares your view about the standards."

Providing Harris isn't busy visiting the border or anything.

— (@)

To be clear, it ISN'T just that one sentence Kamala is lying about. She is also all-in on the book-banning lie. And she thinks kids are being taught the holocaust wasn't so bad either.

— (@)

Lying about slavery opened the door to Kamala lying about the Holocaust, lying about bool banning, and worst, lying about parents who are concerned about what materials schools are indoctrinating their kids with behind their back. This is why you ALWAYS push back on the Democrat and media (but I repeat myself) narrative. Yes, even when you've endorsed one of DeSantis's GOP rivals.

It'd be nice if Harris took America's Governor up on his offer. They won't, but it would make for great content.

title: Another little person goes viral with anti-Disney rant about canceling dwarves from Snow White: "Is this their woke spin?"
description:
I'm wondering if Disney is shorting (I swear that's an unintentional pun) itself in the market. They seem to enjoy setting investors' money ablaze. Their latest in the genre is a live-action Snow White. Only there is no prince, Snow White sounds like your gender studies major cousin no one wants to sit next to at family gatherings, and instead of seven dwarfs, there is only one hanging out with six full-sized people.

Tammi is the latest little person to go viral blasting Disney for it. Instead of having a movie that would give seven little actors an opportunity they otherwise wouldn't, it was more important for the company to pander to woke Lefties who are five feet or taller.

— (@)

"Is this their woke spin on things? Because it really sucks when they're the ones screaming the loudest about inclusion, and then they pull this stunt. So everyone can be included, except the little people. 'But we did give you that token little person'. Thanks."

In Disney's defense, at least they replaced the little people with a DIVERSE group of full-sized actors. In the Wonka movie, they were all replaced with the same white man in orangeface.

— (@)

The part about the faux inclusion was echoed by actor Dylan Postl, aka Swoggle from The Major Wrestling Figure Podcast (shout out to The Indie God). "[The dwarves] weren't these cave-dwelling monsters the people speak of. They all had seven different characteristics for seven different actors from my community. And I don't feel it's right that got taken away from us."

Though Tammi is missing a key point about the one token little person. He's not just a token. He's thespian Peter Dinklage. He's the reason WHY there are no other little people in the movie.

When the live-action Snow White was announced, he lashed out calling it "tone-deaf" when it came to its depiction of the seven dwarfs. "F*cking backward," he cried. Disney bent the knee... so they could look him in the eye and tell them they'll fix in. The seven dwarves became seven mystical creatures. Six of them full-sized... and the seventh Peter Dinklage.

He made it so he screwed out all the other little people actors out of roles, yet still got the job himself. Savage.

title: Bud Light waves the white flag, admits their customers aren't coming back after disastrous Dylan Mulvaney stunt
description:
It has now been month five since the Death Star known as Dylan Mulvaney blew Bud Light out of the beer-flavored water. Ok, so it wasn't Dylan's fault as much as it was the globally elite executives AT Bud Light who signed the deal. Dylan just got paid, and I would never fault a man or woman for getting that bag. Wherever the blame lies, Bud Light distributors have come to the conclusion that their lost customers are never coming back. Now what?

After four months of hiring freezes, layoffs, Bud Light falling out of the #1 spot on an assortment of metrics, and an over 25% drop in sales, distributors are resigned to the fact it's never going to get better and the beer needs to find some new customers to market to, according to the New York Post.

“Consumers have made a choice,” said an executive at a Texas-based beer distributor who did not want to be identified. “They have left [Bud Light] and that’s how it’s going to be. I don’t envision a big percentage of them coming back.”

“There is an increasing feeling that this [Bud Light] decline rate could last for a while and the distributors are worried about losing those drinkers to other similar brands,” David Steinmann, executive editor of Beer Marketer’s Insights, told The New York Post.

As surprising as it may sound, this is the first time we've used this .gif in a Bud Light post.

To be clear, it's the Bud Light DISTRIBUTORS who are saying this. Bud Light themselves haven't surrendered (yet) and global corporation Anheuser-Busch only cares about the global markets. But it was a distributor who first rang the alarm bells BACK IN APRIL where things were heading: "I've never seen such little sales in these past few days on these products. It's sad because if people don't buy this beer, I don't make money and I can't feed my family. It's kinda heartbreaking that Annheuiser Busch did what they did. They don't know their clientele."

— (@)

Let's recap how we got here.

Bud Light's Keys to DERPtory


1. Controversial titface performer Dylan Mulvaney announced he and/or she was a new brand ambassador for Bud Light as part of their March Madness campaign. An odd choice since in Dylan's portrayal of a woman he presented as someone too ditzy and basic to know what March Madness was, as opposed to any of the thousands of women who love college basketball.

2. A podcast appearance of now-former Bud Light VP Alissa Heinersceid came to light. The now disgraced marketing elitist lashed out at Bud Light customers as "fratty" and "out of touch. It was important to her to have another approach that included a San Francisco-based "influencer" marketing firm setting her up with Mulvaney. There is a trend with progressives where the only way to be "inclusive" and "for everyone" is to sh*t on the people who currently enjoy a product. It's called the Kathleen Kennedy method.

3. No one at any level of AB, ABInBev, or Bud Light thoughts to utter four simple words: "Sorry, we f*cked up."

After Bud Light's role as the #1 beer in America was sabotaged by people who don't drink Bud Light and hate people who do drink Bud Light because they want their customers to be someone else entirely, the company is in a position where they "need to focus on a new crop of drinkers." People who enjoy the taste of a glass of water if you swished around dirty pennies in it have Coors Light and Miller Lite to choose from. Others are hopefully turning local and checking out any of the local breweries in their neighborhood.

I say Bud Light owns it and goes hard in the other direction. Make Dylan Mulvaney the official Queen of Beers. Bring in former VP Melissa Weinerchild to say "You're goddamned right I think you rubes are fratty and out of touch." And target to a niche audience of upper-class elitists and gender identity-obsessed progressive zoomers who demand their political worldview be validated by everything and everyone.

The company will never admit it made a mistake. Double down on that mistake then.

title: Chris Pratt shines at Dodgers Faith Night after ‘Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence’ debacle: "Jesus has been after me..."
description:
The Los Angeles Dodgers held their “Christian Faith and Family Day” on Monday. They haven't held one since 2019. It was announced in response to the Dodgers honoring blasphemous drag nuns "Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence" last June. The Dodgers had done the right thing and uninvited the Sisters, but then Los Angeles politicians bullied the team into reinviting them. "Christian Faith Day" was to be the compromise hosted by Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw.

Fans who stayed after the team's unfortunate loss to the Cincinnati Reds got to hear from one of the few a-list celebrities who is open about this Christian faith, Chris Pratt. I'm sure the usual suspects will be on the attack over him speaking at the event by lunchtime.

— (@)


— (@)

Pratt gave a powerful testimony of his Faith and what accepting Jesus into his life has meant.

"It has truly made the difference in my life. It has grounded me in a way that I honestly could never have been grounded. I live in this crazy world with all you folk and I see the weirdest stuff in Hollywood. And I'm really grateful I have that anchor. Jesus has been after me my whole life."

— (@)

I look forward to seeing how much content is created bashing Pratt for praising Jesus without also affirming the Sisters who bash Jesus and call it family-friendly entertainment.

I turned off the internet for June. What happened with the sisters of the what now?


You may remember the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence from such blog posts last this 2019 classic, "ANOTHER Child Sex Offender Discovered at 'Drag Queen Story Time'." The "Sisters" frequently dress as Jesus, Mary and other religious figures, and brag about mocking the Stations of the Cross, and even the Eucharist. The Dodgers had uninvited them from Pride Night when it was brought to the team's attention that this is considered offensive to millions of people.

NOTE: No one complained about the Dodgers having a Pride night. It was just this one group of blasphemous queens.

After the "Sisters" were uninvited, leftist politicians got involved and the team was forced to bend the knee and invited them back with a full-throated apology. LGBTQ activist bullies demand you support their every kink, or else.
